trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand"></xref> objects.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The class object provides the container for the commands of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>.

Accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Commands%2A> property of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> retrieves an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> object.
An application can programmatically add or remove commands.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> class implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase> class.
Adds a command to the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The command to add to the end of the collection.
Adds a command at the location in the collection specified by the index parameter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A value of -1 for the `index` parameter specifies that the command is added to the end of the collection.
The location in the collection at which to add command.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand"></xref> to add to the collection.
Clears the collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.Clear%2A> method for all the classes where this method applies.

For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.Clear%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.
Returns the index of the command whose name is the specified string.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns the index of the command whose <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand.Name%2A> property is the string specified by the s parameter.
If matching items are not found in the collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.IndexOf%2A> method returns -1.
A string to search for in the collection.
The index of the command whose name is the specified string.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is tracking view-state changes.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if tracking view-state changes; otherwise, `false`.
Returns an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand"></xref> item in the collection for the specified index.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The index of the item to get.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand"></xref> item at the specified index.
Loads the previously saved view state to the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The object containing the view-state information to be loaded.
Removes the command with the specified name.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name of the command to remove.
This method removes the first command that matches this value in the collection.
Removes the command at the specified index.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The index number of the command to remove.
Saves the changes to a server control's view state to an <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the view-state information.
Instructs the collection to track changes to its view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
`true` if view state changes are being tracked; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState(System.Object)"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
An object representing the state to be loaded.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
Returns an object that contains the view state changes, if any, or `null` if there are no changes.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
